description.narrative: The Quality Technical Assurance Group (QTAG) enables both the Governments of Australia (GoA) and Papua New Guinea (GoPNG) to make informed decisions and exercise greater accountability for the performance and quality of agreed strategies and selected programs. This investment will be done through the strategic oversight and decisions-making bodies of the two programs, namely the Strategic Management Committee (SMC) for Governance and the Strategis Program Governance Meeting (SPGM) for the Justice Services and Stability for Development Program (JSS4D). The QTAG will operate for an initial period of approximately 36 months from July 2017 and will supply experts, who are professoinals in their respective fields and provide quality advice and guidance across the range of thematic areas covered by the Facility and program. The total value of this investment is $3.7 million over 3 years, starting 2017-18.
